body:
(I'm not in a location where I can easily reproduce this currently)

Can you try in gdb (and post the results):
`thread apply all backtrace`

It looks like there's some kind of deadlock happening at shutdown here. The above command should give me enough information to fix it.

Will do tomorrow AM. Thanks!
On May 20, 2015 5:47 PM, "Craig Tiller" notifications@github.com wrote:

> (I'm not in a location where I can easily reproduce this currently)
> 
> Can you try in gdb (and post the results):
> thread apply all backtrace
> 
> It looks like there's some kind of deadlock happening at shutdown here.
> The above command should give me enough information to fix it.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/1679#issuecomment-104048644.

30062 pts/1    Sl+    0:00 /usr/local/bin/ruby bin/rails runner puts "hi with spring"

Tim: it's probably worth trying to reproduce this (and maybe building a test around it)
This is a blocker for using gRPC with a default Rails application.

@jayantkolhe: removing the beta milestone

Rationale:
- since this was reported, there have been significant changes to how shut down works as multiple wrapped layers have had and fixed shut down issues.  E.g, #2946, #2720, and most recently for ruby,  #3144.
- it's not practical to include automated tests for rails itself in the grpc ruby test suite; the ruby test suite has enough tests that already cover shut down

Next steps
- a manual attempt to reproduce using that latest version of the core and ruby extension.  As there are no api changes involved, this work and and changes that result from it need not block beta
Not sure about the releases, but this is fixed in master! :trophy:
Cool, thanks for the update - closing!
